author: Vijetha S N
text:
A mobile application to track and improve the health of women during and after pregnancy was launched by the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike here on Friday.

Those who want to use the app can sign up for it and download it on their phones. Called, ‘mHealth’ it is also programmed to keep track of immunisation requirements of children below two years.

“In the initial phase, the app will be used in a pilot study in the city by 12 Junior Health Assistants and 24 Accredited Social Health Activist (ASHA) workers from three Primary Health Centres, covering Gangondanahalli, Avalahalli and Pantharpalya wards,” said Mayor Manjunath Reddy, adding that they soon hoped to directly benefit approximately 3,000 pregnant women and 2, 800 children, below two years, living in around 17 slums across the city.

The platform has great potential to be scaled up, believes the developers. “On the basis of a review of the programme’s impact on the existing health system on maternal and child health, this mobile application could be scaled up to 198 wards of the city in close coordination and partnership with BBMP,” said Mathai Kutty from World Vision India, which helped develop the app.

“The app is a big step in ensuring good quality services in terms of safe motherhood and immunisation activities in the centre as well as at the field level,” said Veena, Medical Officer at the Primary Health Centre, Gangondanahalli, Bengaluru.

Children below two years will also be monitored for regular immunisations
title: BBMP launches app, ‘mHealth’, for women
